Column Comment.0: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: CHANGE NOTICE PERIOD: The period of notice that must be given before thisschedule can be changed. May be a number of days, months or no notice required.
Column Comment.5: CONTRACT ID: Unique identifier for the contract table.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the fee schedule came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE OBSERVATION NUMBER: foreign key to thebusiness associate address that the rate is payable to.
Column Comment.9: OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SOURCE: foreign key to the business associateaddress that the rate is payable to.
Column Comment.10: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium. Identifies theorganization that is the owner of this rate schedule.
Column Comment.11: R PAYMENT METHOD: The preferred method to be used for payment, such asdirect deposit, check, cash only, money order etc.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: PREFERRED CURRENCY UNIT OF MEASURE: The currency in which the ownerprefers to receive payment.
Column Comment.14: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique code identifying the provision in the contract.(could be same as clause number e.g. 16 or entered as 16 even though clause isactually numbered XVI - facilitates easier query)
Column Comment.15: SCHEDULE TYPE: the type of rate schedule, such as a regulatory body lessorschedule for rental payments.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: narrative comments about the land fee schedule.
Column Comment.17: REVIEW FREQUENCY: The frequency with which this rate schedule may bereviewed and revised. Note that an obligation is not necessarily subject to the mostrecent version of a rate schedule, depending on the terms of an agreement.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE DOCUMENT: the source document for this rate schedule.
Column Comment.20: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the spatial area in whichthis rate schedule is valid.
Column Comment.21: RATE SCHEDULE OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique number for the version of thespatial description that the rate schedule is valid for.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
